direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pray what is there to celebrate? JACK holds up his hand for silence. A series of creaks and groans from the ship. The coffee pot tilts on its gimbals.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have made our turn northward, Doctor. We are headed back toward the sun... The officers give a slightly ragged cheer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...in anticipation of which. I asked Killick to prepare something special. (shouts off) Killick. Killick there. KILLICK comes in with his usual exasperated expression, bearing a tray with a silver tureen lid on it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which I was just coming. He lays it on the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gentlemen, I give you... our destination. He whips off the lid to reveal a strange glutinous mass, a pudding cut in the oddest of shapes. Everyone stands to get a better look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Galapagos Islands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Pon my word so it is. Look: here's Narborough, Chatham and Hood...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's where the whalers are, ain't it Mr Allen. So that's where the Acheron will be headed. The mood is now taken over by the glee of recognition, as the officers marvel over the pudding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Pullings, if you'll permit me, a slice of Albermale. For you Doctor, Redondo Rock. There's a tiny man-of-war made of icing, between the islands. JACK picks it up in his spoon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And, with a fair wind behind us the Acheron for me. 167.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Slow pan over a glassy expanse of water. JACK's head suddenly breaks the surface, close to camera. As he swims he brings the Surprise into view. The ship is utterly becalmed, wallowing in the swell, her sails hanging limp. A 'painted ship upon a painted ocean'. JACK swims around the ship, which currently presents a less than warlike picture with washing hanging from every part of the rigging. He calls up to PULLINGS -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Best bowers chipped... Lot of rust on these forechains... black strake needs another coat. 168.   QUARTERDECK JACK comes aboard, takes a towel from KILLICK and looks about him. The men are holystoning the deck and polishing the brightwork. They look thin and exhausted and burnt dark-brown by the sun and wind. 169.   FORECASTLE Killick is with NAGEL and others tarring the ratlines as he looks back at HOLLOM, patrolling the gangway. KILLICK indicates him with a tilt of the head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That engagement off Recife: his whole gun crew killed and him not a mark on him. Soon as he went up the mizzen mast Warley falls. And whose watch was it when we lost our wind? HOLLOM sees them looking at him. 170.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A marine sentry, TROLLOPE, stands guard by the ship's water- barrel - the level is very low. STEPHEN ladles some water into a phial.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One glass per man, sir, Captain's orders. STEPHEN straightening, irritated by the challenge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A mere thimbleful, Corporal, for scientific purposes only. 171.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the gloom of his cabin, STEPHEN angles the mirror of his brass microscope toward the window, and places a slide containing a droplet of water under the lens. 172.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - DAY JACK climbs into the top. He adjusts his telescope, studies the horizon. 173.   JACK'S TELESCOPE P.O.V. He pans across the empty sea. 174.   STEPHEN'S MICROSCOPE P.O.V. An assortment of mobile, transparent micro-organisms rotating wildly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My God, Padeen, a veritable zoo. PADEEN takes a look, amazed then greatly amused. 175.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charts are spread all over the table, STEPHEN poring over them when Jack comes in [   ]
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Show me where these Doldrums lie? JACK joins him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stephen. Will we never make a sailor of you? The doldrums is a condition, not a region. But you tend to strike 'em here... (pointing) ...between the trades, and the sou'easterlies. I hope the Acheron is having it as bad as we are. STEPHEN considers their current position on the chart, the tiny Galapagos Islands to the north and the vast emptiness to the west of them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Assuming he is heading for the Galapagos, and not some other point in all this vastness?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come. I'd have thought you'd be delighted to go there. It is said to be a natural paradise
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In truth I'd be delighted with the merest guano stained rock provided it didn't sway beneath my feet
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, we'll take on food and water once we're there, and as compensation for not having put ashore in Brazil I pledge that during that time, several days at least, you can wander at will, catching bugs and beetles to your heart's delight. You will be the first naturalist to set foot on the islands. That is my solemn promise
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I accept, provided the men have not mutinied and thrown us all overboard before we get there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mutiny? No. They are already counting their share of the prize money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Another week of this and they shall gladly give it up for a glass of clean water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ach, Stephen. Stephen. Pray stop your bellyacheing. We shall have rain presently, and if not we shall damned well tow ourselves out of this. 176.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Disgruntled, under-slept men, in boats towing the ship. NAGEL and DAVIES look back darkly at HOLLOM who sits in the stern.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stroke. Stroke...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I heard he were on the Fair Marion as foundered off Tresco. And he were on the Zephyrus what exploded at Trafalgar. HOLLOM has heard this, as DAVIES intended, but he looks away choosing to ignore them. 177.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A view from above of men towing the ship. Over this an unpleasant scraping sound - chalk on slate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: M-a-s-t... mast STEPHEN is writing words on a slate then offering them to BONDEN whom he is teaching to read.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: S-u-n... sun STEPHEN nods and scratches another word on the board. As BONDEN struggles to decipher it there's the sound of a musket shot and a seabird falls out of the sky. HOWARD, the captain of marines, reloads his smoking musket laughing aloud.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that man completely mad? (shouts down) Mr. Howard, a petrel is not good eating! HOWARD looks up towards them, a broad smile on his red moon of a face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Were you never a man for sporting, Doctor? Why you could shoot all day in these waters with two men loading! 178.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The midshipmen and powder-monkeys have assembled for weapons practise, armed with cutlasses. CALAMY and WILLIAMSON divide the group into two teams, choosing sides as for school-yard football.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blakeney...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rye...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Swift...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boyle...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (the final choice) All right, come on Addison. Little ADDISON joins CALAMY's side, trailing his too-large sword. WILLIAMSON tosses a coin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Heads.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's tails. We attack. CALAMY's side retire to a defensive position made of tar barrels at one end of the deck. From here they are suddenly aware of Jack idly watching their mock-fight from the quarter-deck WILLIAMSON's team give a yell and charge at them. It's serious fighting. Heads are struck, fingers are rapped. BLAKENEY, trying gamely with his left arm but frustrated by his own ineptitude, goes down under the rush of attackers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ow ow ow!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yield.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let go of him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yield!! CALAMY can't drag the bigger boy off. He whips a pistol out of his belt and fires it at WILLIAMSON's head. WILLIAMSON is blasted sideways, clutching his face and yelling in pain. The other boys separate, horrified.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's just powder. There wasn't a ball in it, just powder. He helps BLAKENEY to his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you all right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Angrily shaking free of him, he looks to where Jack stood, but the captain is no longer watching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's wrong? I saved you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't need to be saved. 179.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tar bubbling under the heat of the sun. Cannons fizzing and steaming as they are washed. There's been a change of crews in the long-boats, and HOLLOM and his men are now back on board. NAGEL is approaching from one end of the narrow gang-way, HOLLOM from the other. NAGEL pushes past, deliberately bumping HOLLOM, who stumbles, clutching for the gunwale. 180.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - DAY JACK sees this outrageous act of indiscipline and yells out -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Master at arms! Take that man below and clap him in irons. Mr. Pullings, defaulters at six bells. 181.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - DAY JACK stands behind his desk, brow like thunder. From outside the sounds of the muster. HOLLOM stands in front of him, twisting his hat between his hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The man pushed past you without making his obedience. And yet you said nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, Sir, I intended to but the right words just didn't...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'The right words'? He failed to salute you. It's deliberate insubordination. HOLLOM looks at the floor, mumbles -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They don't like me, Sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They what? Speak up, man! HOLLOM raises his head and looks at JACK, his eyes shiny with tears and when he opens his mouth the words tumble out in a rush.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've tried to get to know the men a bit, Sir, be friendly like, but they've taken a set against me. Always whispering when I go past, giving me looks. But, I'll set that to rights, be tougher on them from now on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't make 'friends' with the foremast jacks, they'll despise you in the end. Nor do you need be a tyrant. It's leadership they want, strength, respect.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm very sorry, Sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're what twenty-three, twenty-four?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (smiling weakly) Twenty-five next Friday.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've failed to pass for lieutenant twice. You can't spend the rest of your life as a midshipman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll try harder, Sir. KILLICK helps JACK on with his full-dress uniform.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, it's an unfortunate business, Hollom. Damned unfortunate. KILLICK seems to endorse this by placing the captain's hat emphatically on JACK's head. Jack turns and strides out of the cabin, HOLLOM following slowly after him. 182.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The entire crew has been mustered. The uniformed officers line the quarterdeck as JACK reads from the Articles of War.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Article Thirty-Six. All other crimes not capital, committed by any person or persons in the fleet... shall be punished according to the laws, and customs, of the sea.' (then, to NAGEL) Mr. Nagel, you're an old man-of-war's man and yet you failed to salute an officer. You knew what you were doing. Have you anything to say in your defence? NAGEL looks at the deck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, Sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have his officers anything to say for him? DAVIES and KILLICK scowl across the deck at HOLLOM, who looks wretched but says nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seize him up. NAGEL is spread-eagled to the grating, his hands tied.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seized up, Sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One dozen. Bosun's mate, do your duty. The mate takes the leather cat-o-nine tails out of its red bag.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: FADE TO BLACK FADE UP ON

direction.raw_text: - DUSK JACK stands alone, tuning his fiddle. No matter how much he turns the peg the top string always sounds flat. He tunes some more and breaks it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Red hell... 184.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - DUSK JACK (O.S.) ...and bloody death! Every word is plainly audible to the men on watch, who pretend to hear nothing. 185.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - DUSK JACK is fitting a new string. Widen to reveal STEPHEN sitting opposite with his cello.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was merely remarking that you have always prided yourself on not being a flogging captain and this...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am not a "flogging captain". I have not once rigged the grating on this voyage, not once in twelve thousand miles. Besides, I wager you will find a deal more brutality on land. Tightening the new string. The note escalating as he turns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not a party to it on land.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well you are party to it on my ship. Men must be governed. Often not wisely I grant you, but there are hierarchies even in nature, as you've often said yourself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hierarchies. That is the excuse of every tyrant in history. Of Nero. Of Boneparte.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (trying to call a halt) Yes. Fine words I'm sure
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (continues regardless) ...We are not animals and I for one am opposed to authority, that egg of misery and oppression..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very fine words Stephen, but In these current circumstances, hard-work and firm discipline is what keeps our little wooden world together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And grog I suppose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course. What of it? Of course they have their grog!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know Nagel was drunk when he insulted Hollom. And Higgins is never sober. Even the midshipmen...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The men will have their grog Stephen. It is part of the immemorial tradition of the service
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well a shameful tradition it is too. To have them pressed from their homes, kept in a permanent state of dull inebriation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stephen...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...confined for months in a wooden prison, Never more than a few hours sleep and flogged when drunken idleness drives them to....
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Stephen! I warn you that friend or no I will not have you talk of the service like that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am stating plain facts
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (finally explodes) Well I will not hear them! From you or anyone. You understand! Things are as they are for good or bad whether or not they have a place in your damned papist philosophy. If you are here to make music then sit down and play. If not be gone, for you have come to the wrong shop for anarchy! In stony silence Stephen puts down his cello bow and leaves past Killick, who is lurking as always by the door. 186.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something disturbs the dark surface of the water as HOLLOM dips the ladle and fills his cup. A sense of someone moving up behind him. HOLLOM turns abruptly. It's the marine sentry, moving in the shadows. He stares at HOLLOM as he backs away toward the ladder and hurries below. 187.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To reach his quarters he is obliged to walk the length of the berth deck, past HOWARD obsessively cleaning his pistol, another man whittling with a knife, DAVIES adding another link in the tattooed chain about BECKETT's middle. No-one speaks as HOLLOM runs the gauntlet of their stares, acutely aware of his own breathing. It now seems universally to be held that he is the author of all the ship's misfortune. Nagle pointedly turns his back, the scars from the flogging gleaming wetly in the lamplight Hollom's breath quickens. He stumbles on someone's dunnage, almost trips but is caught before he falls. It's one of NAGEL's mates. NAGEL's MATE Careful, sir. 188.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - DUSK HOLLOM comes in, wild-eyed and goes to his berth, breathing hard. CALAMY, BLAKENEY & BOYLE look up from a tense game of cards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you all right, Hollom? HOLLOM shakes his head miserably, hyperventilating.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's not sick. He's useless. He's just dodging work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh shut up Calamay. What do you know about anything? CALAMY glares at BLAKENEY. 189.   INT STEPHEN'S ROOM - DUSK A shot from the deck above. STEPHEN looks up from his book "Di Consolazione Philosophae". Then the sound of bare feet approaching, followed by a knock at the door. Its Joe Plaice, looking agitated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beg your pardon, your honour, but Mr. Howard just shot a sea-monster! 190.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - DUSK STEPHEN and PLAICE stride along to where the marine captain, HOWARD, peers down into the water with one of his men.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doctor! The very man. STEPHEN moves to the rail, looks out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [   ] I wished you'd seen it for yourself, Doctor. The crew never seen anything like it. On the glassy sea, a smudge of blood and some ripples
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was prodigious like a human, though bigger, might have been a sea-elephant, it had a calf with it - I didn't mean to hit the calf, I missed my mark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Howard, let me beg you, if the men can't eat it or I can't dissect it, please do not shoot every creature you see. STEPHEN stares back down at the ripples spreading over the glassy sea. 191.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wide, on the troubled ship, small yellow patches of light visible from the gun-ports. 192.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The men are lying in their hammocks when, from somewhere outside, there comes an ungodly howling. It stops, then comes again, exactly human in its pitch. The crew look at one another. This is like no sound they've ever heard. The howling stops then comes again, from another direction. 193.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT KILLICK and BLACK BILLY listening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did I tell you? The ship's accursed. 194.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT JACK comes up from below.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is that abominable noise, for God's sake?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have no idea, Sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't think it's the Acheron, Sir?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (untypically cutting) The enemy cannot come on us without a wind, Mr. Mowett. He looks about at the terrified faces of the crew. The wailing sound now rises to a shriek, as STEPHEN joins the group.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you make of it, Doctor?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sure I've never heard the like. The crew overhear this and pass it among themselves as another anguished howl fills the night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perhaps it's the mother of the creature Mr. Howard shot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [    ] Creature?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [ ] A manatee. A sea-elephant possibly. Though I have never known one with a cry like this. A glance along at HOWARD on the gangway, as terrified as anyone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bosun. Fire off some flares. 195.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Three flares soar and burst with a ghostly glow, making a pool of blue light around the ship, the sound continuing to echo and re-echo from somewhere beyond. 196.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The light illuminates the half-hour glass, its top-half empty of sand. Like everyone else, the duty sergeant stands frozen to the spot. Jack rounds on him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sergeant, what the devil are you thinking of? Turn the glass and strike the bell. Roused, the duty sergeant turns the glass and time resumes its flow. Two bells are hesitantly rung and the crew regain the power of motion, their limbs still spastic with fear. And when the sound comes once more they all freeze. JACK joins MOWETT at the taffrail. The thing is somewhere out there, whatever it is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perhaps some poor shipwreck? He shouts, a slight nervous catch to his voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ahoy! Is anyone there? Part of him knows it's crazy and of course there's no reply. The sound constantly shifting position, now in the water, now in the sky. JACK turns to see a white face, frighteningly close to his own. It's PADEEN, mouth agape, face unnaturally white, staring into the gloom as though drawn to whatever horror lies out there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Padeen. What are you doing on the quarterdeck? He looks down at the press of men who have gathered at the bottom of the ladder, some with weapons.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Below! All of you men below! (to MOWETT) Tell the bosun those off-duty may sleep with their lamps on. 197.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Several crewmen huddle close together their faces lit by a battle-lantern. Joe Plaice grim. Doudle wide-eyed. Higgins with his alcoholic tremor more pronounced than ever.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Duppies make that noise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See. They know all about this in Africa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's a duppie?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That Warley. Swallow by a fish. Spirit can't get out. Him duppie now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Captain don't even know what that noise be. General nods of agreement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doctor neither, and he knows everything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Joe here's got the most experience in these matters, and new brains to boot, let's hear it from Joe. All eyes on JOE PLAICE. He speaks from the shadows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's the Jonah causing it. That howling thing is a signal to the Phantom-Ship. He's calling it up, don't you see? Every time he's on watch the ship appears. You wait and see, the ghost-ship will appear any time tonight, and take us all straight to the hot-place. Another shriek, closer now, seems to confirm JOE's bizarre theory. 198.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The boys sit together. None of them look at HOLLOM, who sits pale and wretched in a corner of the room, clutching his stomach. 199.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As the howling continues, STEPHEN looks through a number of books on sea-creatures searching for a reference to what they're experiencing. As JACK looks over his shoulder, his eye is caught by a picture in one of STEPHEN's books. He picks it up. Close on the picture - it's an engraving of a giant squid, its tentacles wrapped around a ship. Back on JACK holding the picture up to STEPHEN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't think...? There is a knock on the cabin door and BLAKENEY enters, agitated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's Mr. Hollom, sir, you better come quick. 200.   MIDSHIPMEN'S BERTH HOLLOM writhing in agony on the floor, STEPHEN trying to calm him, shouting for assistance from the midshipmen and then from PADEEN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr Hollom. Sir. Try to contain yourself. Hold his head. Mr Hollom. Padeen 201.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Stephen is writing some case notes in his journal, when Jack puts his head around the door. Stephens POV: The lamp, lighting his face from below and to one side, gives a strange lopsided twist to Jacks smile
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's nothing physically wrong with him. He thinks he's been cursed by the 0men.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then he probably has been. Sailors will abide a great deal, but never a Jonah. It's like a white crow - the others peck it to death.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Jonah'? My God, you believe it too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I desired to save you the trouble of looking for a cure. No doubt it will all be sorted by the morning. 202      FORECASTLE, LATER - NIGHT BLAKENEY stands near the bows peering out into the night. A figure approaches from behind and lays a hand in his shoulder. BLAKENEY nearly jumps out of his skin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Hollom! You gave me such a start. Are you better now? HOLLOM's breathing does indeed seem easier.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Much better, thank you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think the creature is going away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am sure of it. He reaches down, picks up a 12 pound cannonball.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've always been very kind to me. Goodbye, Blakeney. With a sudden movement he's on the gunwale, then he jumps over the side the cannonball in his arms. BLAKENEY looks down with shock to see HOLLOM's pale face receding from him into the depths. It's a moment before he gathers his wits to shout -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Man overboard! 203.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The ship's company are mustered on deck. JACK stands at the sword rack lectern. KILLICK hands him a Bible open at the story of Jonah. JACK looks, then hands it back to KILLICK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The fact is, [   ] not all of us become the men we once hoped we might be. But we are all God's creatures. If some of us thought ill of Mr. Hollom, or spoke ill of him, or failed him in respect of fellowship, then we ask your forgiveness, Lord, and we ask for his. Close on the faces of the crew - KILLICK, HIGGINS, NAGEL, CALAMY, BLAKENEY and finally Stephen who is staring oddly at Jack, as though holding him partly responsible for this latest tragedy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amen. The men on deck remain standing, heads bowed, observing a minute's silence, as the sky begins to pale, and the white disc of the sun appears above them. FASTER DOUDLE is the first to look up, followed by others - the terrible sound has gone and a small puff of wind is stirring the mainsail. 204. HOUR GLASS The sand runs out of the half-hour glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Strike eight bells.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Turn the glass and strike the bell. The glass is inverted. The bell tolls. 205.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The ship moves through a tropical squall. Men rig a sail to catch the water, others appear with barrels and tubs, anything to catch the precious rain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sea birds swarming over a shoal of fish in the foreground as the cry of the distant lookout carries faintly across the sea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Land-ho! 207.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - DAY BLAKENEY runs along the gangway, past STEPHEN, en route to the quarterdeck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give you joy, sir! We have raised the Galapagos! 208.     MONTAGE oF TELESCOPE VIEWS, GALAPAGOS - DAY There's a primeval quality to the landscape, a feeling of a world just born. The wild creatures that inhabit the lava flows and coral beaches confirm this - the giant tortoises, iguanas, sea-lions and penguins, a teeming profusion of exotic animals and plants. 209.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The ship fairly bristles with telescopes. 210.   FORECASTLE A small group of familiar faces share a pocket telescope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't see any wimmun. Just lots of ducks and lizards. DOUDLE takes the telescope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wot? There must be wimmun. T'ain't natural. 211.   QUARTERDECK STEPHEN and BLAKENEY side by side. From both their faces we sense their wonder at seeing these remarkable creatures for the first time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How extraordinary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What, sir?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Those birds! He's looking at a group of unremarkable black seabirds waddling about on a rock, flapping short, stumpy wings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A species of cormorant. But apparently flightless, by all that's Holy. I believe that is unknown to science. BLAKENEY dwells briefly on the strange rock-climbing birds then drifts back to the iguanas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The dragons don't seem to bother 'em.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They are a type of iguana I should think, and therefore vegetarian. His telescope remains focussed on the cormorants. BLAKENEY is wholly absorbed in the iguanas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will you catch one?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Most certainly. And if we can, some eggs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I mean the great lizards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh! Recognizing how superficially dull the birds are to BLAKENEY's untutored eye, by contrast with giant lizards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I should think a pair of them. Then you can present one of their offspring to the king.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ha! There's one going for a swim.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Iguanas are land animals.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not these ones. The prehistoric-looking creatures, as if suddenly awakened, begin diving into the water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By Jove Bonden you are right! Two new species in as many minutes. He breaks off, suddenly aware of a shouted exchange between the lookout and the quarterdeck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is all that confounded bellowing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All hands about ship! BLAKENEY dashes off and STEPHEN is elbowed out of the way by hands rushing to get at the sails.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By your leave sir, by your leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Helms a'lee - off tacks and sheets - mainsail haul! As the ship turns a distant whaleboat appears with six men aboard, pulling out from one of the neighboring islands. 212.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The whaleboat has come alongside. Men swarm down the boarding nets and the whalers are helped aboard, hoarse and exhausted from rowing and shouting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God bless you. Thank you, shipmates. 213.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: IN THE LEE OF THE SHIP'S HULL, (TIME-LAPSE)

direction.raw_text: - LATER, DAY HOGG, the senior whaler, sits with his mates, relating his story to JACK and the officers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We was coming back for fresh lines, hid in that inlet, yonder. Black-three master. Bit beamy and raised in the stern. Meaningful looks among Jack and his men. Its definitely the Acheron he's describing [   ] Hogg meanwhile takes a pint mug of water, gulps it down, and passes it back to BLAKENEY for a refill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hundred thousand pound of good whale oil they stole. Then the bastards...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cuffs him) No swearing on the quarterdeck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (waves ALLEN away) Go on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Then they burnt our bloody ship and headed off, bunch of fugging pirates. Looking pointedly at Allen [      ]
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And her course?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe a point south of west. Following the rest of the whaling fleet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Mowett, these men to be entered on the ship's books. Mr. Allen, lay a course west sou'west. As ALLEN hurries away shouting orders -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Should we not take on fresh supplies, Sir? Those tortoises...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's not a moment to lose, Mr. Pullings. He leaves the quarterdeck and goes below, STEPHEN following. 214.   IN THE GREAT CABIN JACK has taken his jacket off and is already unfurling his charts. STEPHEN hurries in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you forgotten your promise?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (not looking up) Subject to the requirements of the service, Stephen. I could not in all conscience delay for the sake of an iguano or a... giant peccary - interesting no doubt, but of no immediate application.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How can you dismiss, out of hand, the bounty of nature? Knowledge that... that will help to progress...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can see nothing on shore that will progress our mission.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But how can we possibly know what lies [ ] on these islands, perhaps some knowledge that may save life, that...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I will tell you how to save lives Stephen. Inform me how to guide this ship, undetected, under the nose of a 40 gun frigate. That is the job in hand sir. STEPHEN swallows his indignation and tries for a compromise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well perhaps there's an opportunity to serve both our objectives. As I understand it you mean to go round the end of this long island, then start your voyage. I could walk across it, be on the other side long before... JACK shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I would walk briskly, pausing only for important measurements and almost certainly making valuable discoveries...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If wind and tide had been against us I should have said yes. They are not and I am obliged to say no. (with finality) No. STEPHEN is livid. Betrayed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see. So after all this time in your service I must simply be content to form part of this belligerent expedition, hurry past inestimable wonders, bent solely on destruction...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...you forget yourself, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No Jack, You have forgotten your self. You once believed in the rights of each individual man no matter how useless or lowly. But it seems to me now that the long exercise of power has brought you to the point where even a solemn promise...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The promise was conditional.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...a promise to a friend of ten years standing who has stood by you and supported you....
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I command a King's ship, not a private yacht...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...across half the worlds oceans often at risk to his own life
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...and we have no time for your damned hobbies, sir! "Hobbies". So that is JACK's honest view of STEPHEN's lifetime of work in science. He bows slightly, then leaves. 215
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - DUSK STEPHEN stands alone at the taffrail watching as the islands recede in the distance. News of the violent argument has spread and there is many a sympathetic glance, which further humiliates STEPHEN. BLAKENEY approaches him carrying something carefully in the palm of his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir, I found a curious beetle walking on the deck. He opens his hand - close, on a very plain little brown beetle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think it's a Galapagos Beetle, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sure of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Were you to have walked all day on the island, you might never have come across it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That is more than likely, sure. BLAKENEY passes it to STEPHEN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can have it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, Mr. Blakeney. BLAKENEY hovers for a moment, unsure of further conversation, then retreats. 216       IN THE GREAT CABIN - NIGHT JACK sits alone at the table. KILLICK enters with toasted cheese for two.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No music? That's a shame He sets down the toasted cheese.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll just leave the one plate then, if himself won't be joining.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, Killick. Just the one. JACK cuts himself a portion, scowling at STEPHEN's cello which seems to watch him reproachfully as he eats. 217.      STEPHEN'S CABIN - NIGHT STEPHEN takes a dropper, carefully measures twenty drops of laudanum to a glass of water, and drinks. 218.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The lookout leaning out from the cross-trees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On deck there. Object fine on the starboard bow. 219.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: IN THE WAIST OF THE SHIP JACK

direction.raw_text: A barrel is being lifted aboard from the skiff and passed up the side of the ship. 220.   IN THE WAIST OF THE SHIP JACK comes down, accompanied by ALLEN, the acknowledged expert in these matters. Others gather round, including HOGG the whaler, inspecting the stencilled markings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martha's vineyard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, this here's from Boston. I was married there once.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Any road, it's a Yankee barrel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What they call a Bedford Hog in New England.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Acheron touched at Boston.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And it's not been in the water more than a week.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One can't say with any accuracy but...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes you can. There's no sea chummer on it, and the dowels is sound. 221.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - DAY JACK returns to his post.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Continue due west, Mr. Bonden. TOM PULLINGS watches him. There has been a change amongst the officers and crew toward JACK. His relentless driving after the Acheron has reached the point of obsession, an obsession not shared by his exhausted men. He is a lonely, haunted figure as he now steps up on the gunwale, one hand on the ratlines, scanning the empty sea, sensing his enemy is out there, just beyond the curve of the earth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A wild wind humming through the rigging as STEPHEN goes topside. 223.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He finds various hands making the boats secure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you seen the bird, doctor?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have not - no bird these many days. What kind of a bird?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A sort of albatross I believe, or perhaps a prodigious great mew. He has been following the ship since... there he is, crossing our wake! 224.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - DAY STEPHEN runs along the gangway to get a clearer view, checking himself when he sees JACK on the quarterdeck. Their eyes meet. The quarterdeck is JACK's domain now, and STEPHEN avoids it. Then, behind JACK, the great bird suddenly appears. It's huge, with at least a fourteen foot wing-span, and flying very close to the ship, drifting and soaring on the gusting wind, appearing and disappearing between the sails. STEPHEN is mesmerized by it. He lets go of the rail, leaning forward to get a better view. At the same time across from STEPHEN on the opposite gangway, HOWARD and two or three marines open fire on the bird. The bird drops low, flying right by STEPHEN. Again a crackle of gunfire, but the bird is apparently uninjured, and it banks away, skimming the surface of the water. STEPHEN sags to the deck. A shout. People running. Blood spreading across the white of his shirt. HOWARD there by his side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My God, man! I'm so sorry. The bird dropped low. I didn't see you there! JACK is there, shouting -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Calamy! Get Higgins! (then turning to BONDEN) Padeen, Davies, carry the Doctor below. STEPHEN gets slowly up, hands reaching to help him, HOWARD in the background distraught, explaining to anyone who'll listen what happened.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's all right, I am quite capable of walking. He tries to stand, crumples. 225.        STEPHEN's CABIN - DAY HIGGINS presses clumsily around the wound as STEPHEN lies on the bed, his abdomen rigid, his breathing laboured. JACK watches from the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You will just make it worse... by prodding, Mr. Higgins, it cannot be got at... except by opening me up. A violent pitching of the ship makes it obvious how impossible this will be under sail. As STEPHEN lapses into unconsciousness, HIGGINS looking alarmed, approaches JACK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The bullet took a piece of shirt in with it. Unless it is removed it will suppurate and fester.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you equal to the task?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll need to read up on the Doctor's books, like. Study some pictures he has, get my bearings. Be better on land, but I'll manage somehow. JACK looks away from the alcoholic HIGGINS back to STEPHEN. 226.   OUTSIDE THE CABIN JACK passes an anxious crowd of the ship's company: BLAKENEY, JOE PLAICE, KILLICK and HOWARD.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You men get about your business. There are dark looks in JACK's direction as he retreats to his cabin. 227.   THE GREAT CABIN - DAY JACK throws a chart on the table. With his protractor he marches out great strides west into the Pacific from the Galapagos Islands and marks the ship's position - they are maybe a hundred miles from the Galapagos, ahead, open sea until the Marquesas. 228.       INT. STEPHEN'S CABIN - DUSK Lying on his bed, in some pain, STEPHEN hears thudding feet, shouted orders. In his weakened state, the sounds tend to merge. His pitching cabin keeps swimming out of focus. There's a knock on the door and JEMMY DUCKS appears with a mug of soup and some biscuit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...sail on the horizon, sir. Hull down, running west. It may be a couple of days before we can catch her. STEPHEN nods, all he wants is quiet. JEMMY DUCKS retreats, as STEPHEN swigs from a little bottle of laudanum, which for a moment brings peace, effectively blocking out the noise from above. A smile to PADEEN, like a farewell, and he closes his eyes. 229.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - DUSK JACK, telescope to his eye, studies the distant ship as PULLINGS jumps down from the ratlines to the deck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It might be the Acheron. If we put on more sail we'd come up with her before nightfall. JACK lowers the telescope, turns his back on PULLINGS, strangely abstracted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to his back) Do you wish me to set the topgallants? (no reply) Sir? A long silence. Then JACK walks away. PULLINGS stares perplexed from JACK's retreating figure to the distant chase.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Early morning light on the interior of the cabin. PADEEN is asleep, holding a Bible, in the doctor's chair. STEPHEN himself lies motionless with his eyes closed and his mouth open, no colour in his face. The sea is relatively calm. From outside the sound of the bosun's orders, over rattling blocks and pulleys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Clap on now! Every rope an end... Jolly-boat away... Slowly, Jenks! You grass-combing lubber! MOWETT comes in, sees STEPHEN, and takes him for dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shouts outside) Davies! Slade! Two big men come in behind him. PADEEN wakes, confused and pushes them away, moving protectively to the doctor's side. The commotion disturbs STEPHEN. His eyes open. Like a dead man just come back to life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doctor. You're still with us. Can we move you onto a stretcher? STEPHEN swallows uncomfortably and tries to make sense of things. 231.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A giant iguana watches as a small procession trudges up the stony beach. At its head, STEPHEN is carried in a litter up to where a tent has been set up above the high-water mark. His P.O.V. as JACK appears in the blue sky above him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me this wasn't on my account?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (dead pan) No. It was because of Higgins. (beat) Can't have him poking around in your belly without a solid platform to work on. He ducks as they enter - 232.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the creamy light, they lay STEPHEN down on a recently- constructed wooden operating table. HIGGINS squats on the ground, rummaging through various large sharp surgical instruments which he has emptied onto a piece of Hessian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All set, Higgins? STEPHEN grabs JACK's sleeve.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not Higgins. I do this with my own hand. Jack frowns, unsure what he means by this. EXT. THE TENT - NIGHT PADEEN stands, arms crossed at the closed tent-flap, keeping at bay a crowd of well-wishers, and the merely curious. INT. THE TENT - NIGHT STEPHEN sits pale and sweaty, propped up on a series of chests, his back against a coil of rope. In front of him, suspended by pulleys, LAMB and NAGEL have set up a large gilt-framed mirror. Beside him, on a white tablecloth, some small scissors and scalpels.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (To Jack) [ ] You are sure you have a head and a stomach for this kind of thing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My dear Doctor, I have seen blood and wounds since I was a little boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then hold my belly, pressing firmly when I give the word. STEPHEN begins first with the knife, then the probe - the grind of metal on living bone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You will have to raise the rib, Higgins. Take a good grip with the square retractor. Up. Harder, harder. (to himself) Snip the cartilage. The metallic clash of instruments, perpetual swabbing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now, Jack, a steady downward pressure. Good. Keep it so. Give me the davier. Swab, Higgins. Press, Jack, press. JACK closes his eyes. STEPHEN draws in his breath, arches his back, and it's done.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There she is. He pulls out the bullet, and with it, a fragment of his shirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that all of it? The bloody piece of shirt is handed to HIGGINS who matches it to the hole in STEPHEN's old shirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aye, she'll patch up nicely, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Easy away, Jack. Handsomely with the retractor. Higgins, look to the Captain, while I swab. HIGGINS helps JACK into a chair, pressing his head down between his knees. After a moment, and a few deep breaths, JACK looks up. STEPHEN smiles at him. A hint of surly triumph.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: FADE TO BLACK FADE UP ON

direction.raw_text: Through a gap in the door of his tent STEPHEN can see the distant ship at anchor. Repairs are underway, guns being unloaded, stores and fresh water being ferried aboard. BLAKENEY comes in, followed by PADEEN with a some numbered boxes hung round his neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My goodness, what is this? BLAKENEY starts rolling up the sides of the tent as PADEEN unloads his boxes, each with a beetle and a piece of vegetation in it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well sir, Padeen and I have been doing some collecting for you. The beetles each come with a specimen of plant they were found on. Ooops. Catch him, Padeen! There he goes. He finishes rolling up the tent sides to reveal a collection of cages, with native wildfowl in them, being fed by the poulterer, JEMMY DUCKS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The birds were snared by Jemmy Ducks. Captain says we can keep them in the chicken coop. Then, producing a notebook -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I made a few notes if you want to see them. STEPHEN flips the pages: No 22. Large square black beetle with pincers. Found under rock. Eats earthworms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Pon my word you have the makings of a true naturalist. BLAKENEY is flattered but unsure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well sir, perhaps I could combine them, and be a kind of Fighting-Naturalist, like yourself? [   ] Stephen smiles at this description as he levers himself into a sitting position.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shall we take a tour of your aviary? BLAKENEY looks doubtfully at the doctor's bandaged abdomen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Should you really be up?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Padeen! PADEEN puts the escaped beetle in his mouth for safe keeping and offers STEPHEN a hand. STEPHEN pulls himself painfully to his feet and starts buttoning his shirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (To Blakeney) How long does the Captain intend that we stay here, do you know? ON THE BEACH - DAY JACK is watching those of the crew not on duty play cricket on the shore, with a canvas ball and stumps made of driftwood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, a week perhaps. There is no great hurry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But surely, we must make haste for the Marquesas?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It may not have been the Acheron that we sighted. Nor can we be sure of her destination. (looks away) No, I think we shall go home now, before peace breaks out with France, God forbid. He's making light of what has been a huge and far-reaching decision.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But how will it sit with the Admiralty? To have spent six months in a fruitless pursuit and then come home empty-handed?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Empty-handed"? Not a bit of it. What about these plants and animals which Blakeney has been collecting? The British museum will need an entire new wing for 'em. STEPHEN regards him gravely, shaking his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I fear, Jack, you have burdened me with a debt I can never repay. He is absolutely sincere about this, to JACK's great embarrassment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tosh. Name a shrub after me. Something prickly and hard to eradicate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A shrub? I shall name a giant tortoise: Testudo Aubreii! 237.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - DAWN STEPHEN, BLAKENEY and PADEEN leave the camp on STEPHEN's first day of exploration. They are armed with nets, baskets and a day's supply of food and water. STEPHEN walks slightly stooped, leaning on a walking stick. 238.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A strange and wonderful landscape lies before them, with its organically-shaped lava flows and alien-looking flora and fauna. Everywhere STEPHEN looks there are creatures unique to the islands. He is in his element, collecting specimens which PADEEN carefully stores in the baskets. BLAKENEY has his telescope trained on some distant humps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doctor, would you think it very unscientific of me to ride on the back of one of those tortoises.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, Mr. Blakeney. I would think it an experiment of absolutely vital importance. But afterwards, I do desire to find that flightless cormorant, assuming that is what it is, and that I still have strength enough to catch it. 239.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - DAY BLAKENEY gets astride a giant tortoise and burns his bottom on its scorching hot shell. 240.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - DAY STEPHEN with his telescope taking notes on bird-life. 241.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The huge, strangely balletic figure of PADEEN chasing after a butterfly in evening light. 242.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wide to see another aspect of the countryside - a hint of distant sea, a rocky headland rising from the plain. The group is widely scattered. STEPHEN at the base of the headland, BLAKENEY half a mile further inland. PADEEN coming up slowly behind, laden with the fruits of their expedition. 243.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - DAY STEPHEN rests a moment. Some stones rattle down from the hillside. He looks up to see a flash of black feathers near the crest - the cormorant. On his shirt a red smudge has appeared. His wound has begun to bleed again. Ignoring this, Stephen pushes on after his quarry. 244.   THE ROCKY SLOPE Near the top, STEPHEN pauses to catch his breath and glances above him. Again the bird, moving higher, as if leading him on. STEPHEN gets down on all fours, crawling cautiously to the crest just above him. 245.   TOP OF THE HEADLAND A clearing. There is movement in the bushes. STEPHEN slowly rises, climbs the few paces to the hilltop and enters a clearing. He searches amongst the bushes. Nothing. He turns and looks back down the hillside to see BLAKENEY and PADEEN far below, then sits to get his breath back again. STEPHEN'S P.O.V: on the ground between his feet, a beetle. He picks it up. Close, on his hand. It is the same type of beetle BLAKENEY gave him aboard the Surprise. Smiling at the coincidence STEPHEN raises the tiny creature to eye level. His P.O.V.: the beetle, the creature in sharp focus, behind it the sea, and on the sea, a black shape. The focus shifts to the background - a ship at anchor in a bay. The beetle flies away as STEPHEN stares out at the ship. It's the Acheron, and they are weighing anchor. 246.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - DUSK BLAKENEY urging STEPHEN to hurry as they make their way through the darkening landscape. All kinds of creatures are appearing around them, and every few yards STEPHEN pauses to examine something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir, you must hurry!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A moment! You're a worse tyrant than any ship's captain. He's breathing hard, exhausted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You must carry him, Padeen! PADEEN looks at the collection of baskets he carries.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leave them! We must get back to the ship. STEPHEN raises his hand in protest, but BLAKENEY is already divesting PADEEN of his load. 247.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - LAST LIGHT PADEEN carrying STEPHEN 'piggy-back', BLAKENEY out ahead urging them on. 247a   THE DISCARDED COLLECTING BOXES A variety of small bugs and animals crawling free 248      STEPHEN'S CABIN - NIGHT STEPHEN gingerly lowers himself into his 'elbow-chair', gripping the table and BLAKENEY's good arm for support. Sighing, he begins emptying his pockets of various small items collected during the day - some leaves, rocks and insects - and places them in ordered piles around his microscope. All about them can be heard the urgent sounds of departure - the anchor rattling up, shouted orders and the drumming of bare feet on the deck above. He holds up a stick in a specimen-jar, and is examining it with his magnifying glass when JACK enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I forgot to ask you - did you see your bird? STEPHEN's eye grossly enlarged through the lens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I did not. My greatest discovery was your phantom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Indeed it was, I'm sorry...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (waving the magnifying glass) Not a bit of it. William and I made a unique discovery. Handing JACK the jar and magnifying glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell him, Mr. Blakeney.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a rare phasmid, Sir. JACK inspects the stick. It winks at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A phasmid?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's an insect disguised as a stick. JACK stares at the creature.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In order to confuse a predator. JACK looks up at STEPHEN. 249.   BAY, GALAPAGOS - NIGHT The Surprise alive with crewmen on the deck and in the rigging. Shouts and commands drift across the water as she turns and heads out from the bay. 249a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - SAME TIME JACK strides along the quarterdeck towards the forecastle issuing a stream of orders -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Hollar, rouse up all the yellow paint we have. I want six men with brushes slung over the side. (moving on) Doudle!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yessir. JACK hands him a piece of paper with a sketch on it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get your sail makers working on this. Sixty yards by five yards with an eyelet every seven feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aye, Sir. He shouts to HOGG who, with a few men, is manhandling a large metal cauldron from the ballast to the gun-deck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to HOGG) Have Nagel patch it up and light a fire in it. (shouts) Mr. Calamy!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aye, Sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Once we're underway, replace some of the sails with the oldest, most patched set we have.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They'll be in the afterhold, Sir. I'll need some men to move all the clutter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good. Spread it around the foredeck. The more mess the better. 249B.    SIDE OF THE SHIP,. NIGHT The ship powers ahead as men swing in harnesses above the racing water, painting out the Nelson chequer. 249C.    ON DECK.   NIGHT NAGEL positions the great cauldron amidships as men come up from below with old barrels and bits of rope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Haul away! On the gangway, Men under CALAMY's instructions haul on ropes, pulling up the old patched sails. The sails lead us up to 250.    CROSSTREES - NIGHT JACK, PULLINGS and the whaler HOGG scan the dark horizon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There, Sir. A mainmast toplight. JACK has to use a telescope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've got good eyes, Hogg. Shouts down to the helm -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Bonden, set a course west-south-west. (to PULLINGS) We'll drop below the horizon and come up on the other side of him, let him think he's seen us first. 251.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: First light reveals the results of an overnight transformation - from a naval warship to a shambolic-looking Portuguese whaler. The gunwales are painted an untidy ochre and the gun-ports hidden behind broad strips of canvas. The sails are patched and ragged, the forecastle cluttered with barrels. Smoke billows from a cauldron amidships. On deck and in the rigging, there's a quarter of the normal complement of men, all of them dressed in purser's slops. 252.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A bemused STEPHEN looks about him as he approaches JACK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see. A wolf in sheep in sheep's clothing
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A phasmid, doctor. It was you what gave me the idea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not sure a phasmid can be a predator.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No? Well this one is. 253.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - DAWN HOWARD and his marines change out of their smart uniforms, into the oldest most ragged clothes on board the ship, much to the amusement of the passing sailors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very fancy. Blue to match your eyes. Is there a skirt comes with it? 254.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Men are checking the breechings of the great guns and chipping cannonballs to make them more perfectly spherical, more deadly. The armourer is at his grindstone sending out showers of sparks, a group of seamen round him relaying one another at the crank, stacking newly honed cutlasses and boarding axes at their feet. Another team check and load pistols by the score. 254.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alone, BLAKENEY awkwardly draws his dirk, left-handed from its scabbard. It glints momentarily in the lamp-light. CALAMY enters, face aglow, abruptly trying to cover his joy when he sees BLAKENEY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's all right. Permission to boast. You're to lead the boarders from the forecastle. Congratulations.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll make lieutenant out of this. The others come in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He already has. 'Acting' 3rd Lieutenant Peter Calamy. Oohs and aahs from all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [       ] Then I'll see you at the forecastle, 'Lieutenant'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's not your station. BLAKENEY looks from CALAMY to the others, who avoid his eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But naturally I'll board with you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry, Will. Captain's orders. BLAKENEY is devastated. Rye bursts in, in a state of high excitement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's seen us! 256.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - DAWN JACK raises his glass, focuses on the Acheron, plainly visible in the distance, with a line of signal flags running up her backstay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's asking us to heave to. Shall I give the order?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, make a show of fleeing upwind, but panicky and disorganized, like a whaler might do. Allen smiles at this unintended slight
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No offence, Mr. Hogg. 257.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A show of chaos on deck as the Surprise veers upwind, away from the Acheron. As she presents her stern we see her new name: Malacca. 258.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Through his telescope, JACK looks back at the Acheron in pursuit, a dark figure on her foredeck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Mowett) Run up Portuguese colours. (then down to the gun-deck) Load, Mr. Pullings. Triple shot 'em. BLAKENEY comes onto the quarterdeck and salutes, looking flushed and angry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: May I speak with you, Sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No saluting, Mr. Blakeney, we're whalers here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Calamy says I am not in the boarding party, I wanted to say -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (interrupts) I know what you want to say and my answer is no. I promised your mother I would return you in one piece and I have already failed her on that score. You will command a gun and then retire to defend the quarterdeck here with Dr. Maturin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But sir -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go to your station, Mr. Blakeney. BLAKENEY begins to salute, doesn't, and retires, tears burning his eyes. A moment later there's a flash of orange astern as the Acheron opens up with her bow-chasers. An 18 pound shot screams past the side of the Surprise to land with a column of spray just off their bows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good shooting. Remind me to press her bow gunner, Mr. Pullings. The second ball takes down some rigging.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Start the water and throw some barrels overboard. He goes below. 259.   WAIST - DAY Barrels go overboard and pumps spout streams of water over the side as JACK runs down to 260.   THE GUN-DECK The great majority of men are gathered here, more than a hundred of them crammed together with their muskets and sabres, listening to the odd thump from topsides as another ball from the Acheron hits home. CALAMY and his gang of young tykes are squashed in there somewhere, BOYLE, WILLIAMS, ADDISON and the rest, eyes shining with nervousness and wild anticipation, as JACK addresses his men, who shout encouragement, ad lib, in every pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (plus the men ad lib) We're a long way from home. (Right you are, Captain!) A long way from anywhere, (Too true!) But if Britain rules the waves she rules these waves too. (Right she does!) And the blow we shall deal for his Majesty here will be felt just as keenly (I'll say it will) aye - and cheered just as loudly ('specially by the wimmin!) - as any dealt at Trafalgar or Cape St. Vincent. The camera moves over the upturned faces, PLAICE, NAGEL, DOUDLE, KILLICK, the midshipmen, the powder-monkeys, the whole fellowship of the ship. And finally STEPHEN watching JACK doing what he does best: transmitting his own fearlessness into other men - the total warrior, the consummate leader.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't say it will be easy. She's twice the men we have and they'll sell their lives dearly. But every man here is worth three of Boney's privateers, and I know there's not a faint heart among you. CALAMY pipes up -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Three cheers for the Captain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Huzzah huzzah huzzah! On CALAMY, cheering like a kid at a football match as... 261.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Another well-placed shot from the Acheron smashes through the rigging, sending down a shower of rope and cordage. JACK is back at his station by the wheel, the Acheron little more than a half a mile astern, the figure of the captain in his black coat clearly visible. JACK studies the looming black vessel, then turns and crosses to BONDEN at the helm. BONDEN nods, lifting his hands from the wheel as JACK grips the curved timber decisively, taking the strain. He feels the pulse of the ship through his fingers, looks up to the sails then back to the Acheron. STEPHEN appears beside him, casually smoking a cigar. He offers one to Jack, who declines [   ] Another shot pierces the mizzen foresail above them, but neither man flinches. KILLICK appears with two cups of coffee, and in his belt a brace of pistols.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I took the liberty, Doctor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [    ] Thank you, Killick. JACK steers one-handed as he sips his coffee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Mowett? [  ] A poem might be in order. Another shot through the sails.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A poem, Sir? [   ] (after a moment's reflection) 'Oh were it mine with sacred Maro's art, To wake to sympathy the feeling heart, A ball goes howling past the ship, MOWETT winces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then might I, with unrivalled strains, deplore, Th'impervious horrors of a leeward shore.' JACK smiles, nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Transfixed with terror at th'approaching doom...'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (apologetic) ...they were only people of the merchant service, of-course, Sir. 262.   P.O.V. ACHERON She's now less than five hundred yards from their stern, and gaining. 263.    QUARTERDECK JACK turns back to MOWETT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have her Mr. Mowett. Strike the Portuguese colours and run up the Jack... Mr. Pullings. Canvas off the gun-ports, and run 'em out. Mr. Howard? Marines away aloft. The British Jack rises to the masthead replacing the Portuguese colours, as PULLINGS descends to the gun-deck. 264. SHIP'S SIDE - The black muzzles appear with a low rumbling sound, as 265.   QUARTERDECK JACK, with a wink to MOWETT, yells at the top of his voice
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Helm's a lee! ....and spins the wheel hard to starboard. 266.   THE SURPRISE Wide, to see her swinging broadside on, across the path of the oncoming Acheron. 267.   POV ACHERON DAY Confused shouts from the enemy's deck, chaos on her forecastle, somewhere a drum beating. 268 + 269.    DELETED 270.   THE SURPRISE QUARTERDECK - DAY JACK hands the wheel to BONDEN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Run us down her larboard side then cut across her wake! (shouts down to the gun deck) Hold fire Mr Pullings! Hold till we're broadside on! 271. - THE SURPRISE AND THE ACHERON Wide, to see the Surprise turning downwind, back towards the Acheron, so they will pass broadside to broadside [   ] no more than thirty yards apart. 272. QUARTERDECK/ GUN-DECK, SURPRISE Through a furious exchange of musket fire JACK runs down the ladder to the gun-deck-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fire as she bears! Every gun to concentrate on her mainmast! Through the gunports the Acheron's great hull becomes visible. Some of the Acheron's guns have run out, but the crews are unprepared and disorganized.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the uproll! Fire for the mainmast as you sight her! As the Surprise rolls and the upper deck of the Acheron becomes visible. 273. THE SURPRISE GUNS Barking, leaping back one by one, great tongues of flame spitting from their barrels, dense clouds of smoke rising. 274.    VIEW OF THE ACHERON With an almighty splitting sound their mainmast falls, dragging yards and rigging with it, the whole mass falling over their side, obscuring many of their gun-ports. 275. GUNDECK/QUARTERDECK, SURPRISE - Cheers from the crew. Jack yelling up the companionway
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now Mr Bonden! Hard a'starboard! 276.    THE SURPRISE AND THE ACHERON The Acheron wallows, bought to a standstill by the enormous dragging weight of their mainmast. BONDEN wheels the ship across the enemy's wake, past the exposed, vulnerable stern. 277.    DELETED 277A.   GUNDECK, SURPRISE JACK Fire at will! 278.    GUN-DECK, SURPRISE In random sequence the Surprise's gunners pound it into the Acheron's stern. Casement windows vanish in a cloud of wood and glass, exposing the Acheron's terrified gun-crews, now open to devastating fire as the Surprise glides past. 279.    QUARTERDECK JACK climbs up on the gunwales, shouting to BONDEN -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lay me alongside! 280.    THE SURPRISE AND THE ACHERON The bow of the Surprise lurches into the Acheron mid-ships, spars interlocking, the Surprise guns firing into her at point-blank range. The crew throw grappling hooks. 281..   QUARTERDECK JACK Boarders away! And he leaps to the enemy deck, a great tide of men following after him. 282.    FORECASTLE CALAMY leads his own children's crusade from the bows and forecastle: youthful but terrifying, screaming and swinging their blades. 283.    QUARTERDECK An agonized BLAKENEY watches from where he stands beside STEPHEN. JOE PLAICE is close by with some of the older men, ready to ferry the wounded below. 284.    ON THE ACHERON As the Surprises pour onto the quarterdeck they face withering fire from the enemy. A dozen men go down, some of them fatally wounded. Among them are DOUDLE, BOYLE, ALLEN and HORNER in quick succession. The attack momentarily falters, and the Acherons surge back at them. JACK rallies his men and they charge again - the marine, TROLLOPE, and NAGEL are blown backwards by grapeshot. LAMB, enraged, surges past NAGEL's body, swinging his axe to devastating effect, with HOLLAR by his side and JEMMY DUCKS protecting their rear, a pistol in each hand, firing from the hip. JACK keeps pushing onwards, the centre of the milling, swirling, hacking crowd, stabbing and pistolling each other with barely room to fall. The Acherons are gradually forced back across their quarterdeck and down into the waist of the ship. 285.   WAIST OF THE ACHERON JACK crosses swords with a man in front of him, as an enemy pikeman drives his blade into his left arm, tearing through the sleeve. BONDEN fires a pistol by his ear, deafening JACK and killing the pikeman. To either side, privateers are trying to reach them, shouting, swearing in English, French and Spanish. Bullets and missiles rain down from above, killing friend and foe alike. KILLICK is in the thick of it, a pistol in either hand, and from his lips a high-pitched blood-curdling scream. AWKWARD DAVIES is foaming at the mouth as he swings a meat- cleaver right and left. 286.   QUARTERDECK, ACHERON A commander of the privateers notes the poorly defended Surprise, and leads a counter-attack over onto her quarterdeck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look to our quarter-deck! 287. QUARTERDECK, SURPRISE BLAKENEY, dirk in hand, turns to face them, as does HOWARD and his men, but they are gravely outnumbered. 288.   FORECASTLE, ACHERON CALAMY sees the danger and leads his gang back onto the Surprise, calling for others to follow. Calamy This way! Follow me! 289. QUARTERDECK, SURPRISE STEPHEN, PADEEN and JOE PLAICE appear from below. STEPHEN picks up a pistol and with deadly accuracy shoots a privateer lunging at CAPTAIN HOWARD. The man drops, a neat hole in his forehead. A moment's astonishment from HOWARD at the Doctor's surprising skill. CALAMY fights his way to BLAKENEY who is down on his knees stabbing at the legs of the attackers. 290.   WAIST, ACHERON JACK, BONDEN and DAVIES are driving a wedge toward the stern, the defenders falling back in disarray. 291.   QUARTERDECK OF THE ACHERON PULLINGS and MOWETT fight side-by-side. A swivel-gun mounted on the taff-rail is swung to face them. The gunner is about to fire when a perfectly-aimed musket ball hits him, again fired by STEPHEN. 292.   QUARTERDECK, SURPRISE/ACHERON CALAMY, BLAKENEY and their group force the counter-attack back onto the deck of the Acheron. The two boys fight as a team as they move toward the stern. 292.   SIDE OF THE ACHERON Some Acherons jump overboard to escape the furious attack. Others are thrown, grasping at woodwork as they fall. 293.   QUARTERDECK OF THE ACHERON JEMMY DUCKS turns the swivel on a group of Acherons, the grapeshot blasting them up against the gunwale. 294.   IN THE WATER Oil burns. Men drown, others struggle to stay afloat, clinging to the mass of wreckage floating by the hull. 295.   WAIST OF THE SHIP Cheering from the Surprises, demands to surrender in many languages, some beg for mercy, others fight on. 296.   BELOW DECKS JACK moves alone, down to the berth deck. He smashes the chain off a locked-door, releasing a dozen or more prisoners. Everywhere signs of the lethal blast through the ship's stern, bodies, guns upended, shattered timbers. He makes his way through to the Great Cabin. 297.   GREAT CABIN, ACHERON Four privateers look up as JACK bursts in. They have been looting their own ship's valuables, two of them are too drunk to be scared.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where is your captain? Ou est votre capitaine? One man leaps out through the shattered windows. A couple of others raise their hands and start jabbering in French and Spanish. 298.   QUARTERDECK, ACHERON It's all over for the Acherons as a French officer hauls down their colours. A cheer from the Surprises - a few last shots fired. CALAMY and BLAKENEY cheering, BLAKENEY holding aloft the captured flag. A dying Frenchman suddenly lunges at CALAMY with a sabre. BLAKENEY steps in front of him and takes the blow. 299.   IN THE SICK-BERTH, ACHERON A doctor is working here, a callow-faced man in a bloody apron, red-eyed from fatigue. JACK enters, a fearsome sight, with his singed yellow hair and blood-stained cutlass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Le Capitaine? Where is he? The doctor points at a body on the operating table. JACK approaches, looks down at the dead man. He's [ ] somewhere about JACK's age, fine-featured, with his black coat draped over his body.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Il mavait prie de vous donner ceci. Passing JACK the captain's sword. 300.   QUARTERDECK, ACHERON JACK picks his way through the dead and wounded to where CALAMY sits nursing BLAKENEY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's dead, sir. Gently, JACK picks up the lifeless body and walks slowly back down the quarterdeck, the boy draped across his arms. Friend and foe part silently in front of him as he crosses the gangway to... 301.   QUARTERDECK, SURPRISE ...then with CALAMY following, he goes below. 302.   THE GREAT CABIN - DAY JACK in wide shot, sitting alone on the bench running under the stern windows. His hunched posture and red tear-stained eyes give a glimpse of his familiar post-battle mood - a mix of grief and depression, the old question, "Was it worth the price?".
direction.name: direction

result.heading: QUARTERDECK OF THE ACHERON JEMMY DUCKS
FADE TO BLACK FADE UP ON

direction.raw_text: The two ships anchored close together on the ocean. 304.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As eight bells are rung for the change of watch we see a row of canvas hammocks each containing the body of a fallen crewman. DAVIES and PLAICE stitch the bodies into their hammocks, BLAKENEY the last body in the line. As the men approach -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll do it. JOE passes him the needle and twine, then they leave him alone. As CALAMY sews up the hammock, HOLLAR's voice is heard distinctly from below.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rise and shine, show a leg there. Tumble up! Tumble up! In close-up: the peaceful face of BLAKENEY HOLLAR (O.S.) (CONT'D) Sleepers awake! ...as CALAMY's hands stitch the canvas closed. 305.
direction.name: direction
